Name: alex logan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 December 2020
Review Content: As a gamer who typically plays on Xbox, I was apprehensive about getting the Playstation 5. Knowing it was slightly under-powered I bought it anyway as I wanted to play my favourite series - Ratchet and Clank. Before I even downloaded any games, I was extremely happy with the feel of the new DualSense controller.The included Astros Playroom game is absolutely wonderful and I got the platinum trophy on it in the first day, without even looking at the other games I downloaded such as Sackboys big adventure. The controller was shown off to its full potential here, allowing you to feel which surface your character runs on, or how far you need to pull back a bow.The console is fast, quiet and a huge step up from the PS4. Buy one if you can!

Name: Stuart
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Verified Purchase

Name: SoYouWantMoore
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 29 January 2021
Review Content: Props to Amazon, delivered by 10am on launch day. The controller is the best thing about the console. WRC 9 and Astro’s Playroom are my recommendations for early next gen experience.Still waiting on Sony to release the VRR patch and announce the expandable storage. 825gb just isn’t enough! Oh, and it’s the ugliest console I’ve ever seen.That said, I love it!

Name: Michael
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2020
Review Content: 25 people found this helpful

Name: ben hooper
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 December 2020
Review Content: Shipped very quickly, set up was a doddle. Even tho people state the xbox is easier to set up, that's not the case. It's exactly the same as the series x. Power it on, open your PS app on your phone and follow instructions. Easy peasy.Very happy with the console, I recommend you try Days Gone since it's been patched for ps5. It's amazing.Only downside is that it's absolutely massive. Had to take a shelf out of my unit and it dwarfs the series x.Would have been better if it was black too, it's not meant to stand out as a focal point.

Name: Ken
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 26 November 2020
Review Content: Other people have done proper reviews; you know it's powerful, quiet, fast, amazing controller, etc etc. I just wanted to point out that I haven't had any issues since I received this on launch day (yes, lucky me) even though I've used it extensively. I haven't had the Rest Mode issue that seems to be common, although a firmware update was released a couple of days ago, so that might have fixed it. The hardware is one hell of a generational leap over the PS4, that's for sure.If I had to nitpick and find a problem, the power controls for shut down and rest mode are a bit hard to navigate to. Also, the stand is not the easiest to attach, and it might frustrate some young children. I'm quite literally struggling to find faults here.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 April 2021
Review Content: It’s now been 2 weeks since I took delivery of my console and I’m delighted with it. I have completed Spider-Man Miles Morales and found the graphics and gameplay to be most enjoyable. I’ve now started playing hitman 3 and have been enjoying that also. As mentioned in other reviews, the machine is very large in size, but is also very powerful.  The fan is silent and the only noise comes from the disc drive, which is to be expected. I believe that the capability of the console will only be realised when there’s more games available and game developers start to get to grips with it’s real potential. Overall, I’m really happy with the purchase so far, and I’m looking forward to playing it in years to come.

Name: Well Read
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Delivered for normal price having pre-ordered. Easy to set up, no issues, can use old PS4 simultaneously on same account in the house which is good. Very very quiet compared to old PS4 and graphics brilliant. Probably not enough games out there to really get a sense of what its capable of, so if you don't have one right now you are not missing out in any way. Worth it when it does come back into stock. No bugs yet!

Name: Bradley Marlow
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 January 2021
Review Content: I was looking forward to this so much but arrived faulty. Couldn't progress past the initial setup and nothing from the Sony website seemed to fix it. Constant freezing.  Gutted to have had to return it.

Name: Mr D.Pollard
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2020
Review Content: The PlayStation 5 is everything gamers wanted — and more. While storage space is a real concern and Sony’s long-term view of industry shifts is questionable, there’s no denying that this is a true next-generation machine. It makes existing games more fun, and has several strong launch titles.Is there a better alternative?No. For holiday 2020, at least, the PS5 beats the competition handily, and makes the PS4 seem almost archaic.How long will it last?Expect a long life from this system. The biggest hurdle is the shift to cloud-based gaming. If that happens quicker than industry insiders expect, Sony could have a hard time keeping up.Should you buy one?Yes, absolutely. The PlayStation 5 is a game system that lives up to the next-generation label.**Updated Review**as of 20th of Nov my console still isn't here but an empty box was simply left at the back door on the garden wall, trying to get assistance with Amazon

Name: Revox15ips
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 April 2021
Review Content: Probably the most difficult item to obtain in recent times. Was lucky enough to bag this seconds after it went live .As expected, it is a faster and smoother transition from its predecessor with excellent gameplay. It is also bigger than expected, looking like a large encyclopaedia when stood up vertically. Overall, very happy with the product.

Name: BubbaLFC
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 April 2021
Review Content: Brilliant console managed to purchase one fromAmazon and the other from another retailer. I must say it’s the best console out there graphics speed of the control is a big upgrade from the PS4. I know lots of people out there are struggling to get one. I put mine in the wish list and then moved it across. There are various apps and sites that will alert you when released for eg Hot Stock and Stock Informer  also I used Twitter and Discord

Name: Tony Redgrave
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 January 2021
Review Content: Had mine about two months now and it’s great, no complaints here. Loading times and graphics are fantastic, even your old PS4 games get their loading times cut down and it definitely feels like a step up from the PS4, and it’ll only get better from here as more PS5 games come out and system updates adding new features are released.

Name: Ryan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 9 March 2021
Review Content: Brought a ps5 couple weeks back had to send it back a day later as it started to make weird noise coming from the disc drive to say I payed £450 for it I didn’t expect to be sending it back

Name: Stu W
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 4 December 2020
Review Content: What a great system. It just screams QUALITY. I really look forward each day to playing on this amazing system and the future of NEXT GEN gaming is looking bright with Sony... Quality product ,, Many thanks,,, Stay Safe...

Name: Jack D.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2020
Review Content: Well, what can I say this feels next gen. the loading times, the graphics are incredible. Blown away. The controller (DualSense) is a masterpiece though, really makes you feel like you’re ‘in the game’ more and I love that. The design of the console is wonderful with many little treats for us playStation fanboys to enjoy. When you can, buy a PS5. You will not regret it.

Name: Dan
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 December 2020
Review Content: Performs very well, very silent and keeps a steady 60fps.Set up was easy, transferred all data from ps4.Big dislike is that just like its predecessor it still does not support bluetooth audio devices!

Name: TDel
Review Title: Still things to iron out but fantastic console
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 March 2021
Review Content: Not usually an early adopter of consoles but now have children....so I usually wait for all glitches/bugs/enhancements etc before buying but this is pretty good straight out off of the production line.Some things I'm not keen on such as the home button functions & Unable to create folders to name a couple but these are opinion based niggles. However, overall a fantastic console.....so much quicker and quieter than the PS4 (I have the Pro). Love the controller that's awesome and the actual console is massive!!!

Name: Donnysgirl
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 April 2021
Review Content: Had been trying to get the PS5 for my Son since first released. Can’t say I’ve ever really taken a lot of notice with any of his consoles but the graphics on this blew my mind. Amazing, even reflections on pathway stones and he was playing a driving game which was so real when it smashed into another that I jumped back from the screen. He loves it so I’m really pleased.

Name: Soulofman5446
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: I've come from a launch day ps4 to the ps5 and this is a substantial upgrade.Transferring my data from the old console to the new one was a breeze.It's easy and snappy to use and the Astro game shows off just how good the new controller is.I thought the size of the console would be ugly and off putting but I fell in love with it straight away.

Name: Shah
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Best PlayStation yet, stuff that was missing in PS4 it has it on this. The controller truly is next generation. I won’t spoil it for you. Will let you experience it. The graphic and ps5 Home Screen amazing I love the sound in the background reminds me of ps2 ps3. Don’t think about it but it if your a gamer. 5* specs. I enjoyed it more then my series x.

Name: Phil Davies
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 13 April 2021
Review Content: Really good next gen from Sony. Everything loads quickly, the graphics are amazing - even on PS4 games,  and the controller is fantastic. Only in it's infancy at the moment, but you can already see from the games available that it's capable of some pretty awesome things. Well worth buying if you have the cash spare and if you can find one!

Name: JDMK
Review Title: Well done Sony, PS5 is simple the best
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 November 2020
Review Content: Pre ordered this back in September, well worth the wait, got to say well done Amazon on for filling my order, the PS5 is simple a beast the controller actions are amazing, Di not under estimate the free games from Sony, yes it details what the PS5 will do, but it one of the  best platform games, cannot wait to see the games over the next few years will bring

Name: GXBLiN GiRL
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 December 2020
Review Content: The PlayStation 5 is one of the best things to come out of 2020. The power of the console is nothing like I've ever seen in any other console! My console got "lost" but Amazon found a replacement and it came very quickly!! Christmas is saved!! The controller is an amazing upgrade from the Dualshock 4, it fits very comfortably into my hands and feels natural to use!

Name: Elisabeth
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 31 March 2021
Review Content: The PS5 came quickly and naturally its going to come with 5* only things I am worried about is the amount of storage space on the console after a quick data transfer from ps4 to 5 I was full! So you will need external storage for this console! It's a lot bigger than I thought even bigger than ps3 as sleek as it is looking its massive! However it's very quite!

Name: pip510
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 March 2021
Review Content: New to the gaming scene and I love this system, the graphics and response times are great. Needless to say im not very good but definitely loving this. Wireless controllers with the haptic response makes games more enjoyable but took a few weeks to get used too. Still learning playing the games we got but its definitely an amazing system.Definitely worth getting the charging stand

Name: Mark N.
Review Title: Good but not worth it yet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 May 2021
Review Content: It’s good. If you’ve not managed to get one yet do not stress, honestly. Demon souls is the only reason to get one now. Otherwise you are not missing out. Returnal looks good, just not for me. Rachet and Clank a rift apart is probably when we will see the PS5 stretch it’s legs. RE8 looks good. But it’s multi-platform. Oh and it’s the semiconductor industry you need to be mad with. Not Sony. They can’t make them any quicker !

Name: Ben Watson
Review Title: A problem free, beast of a console
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 February 2021
Review Content: I've heard a lot of people complaining about issues, and while that might be true, it's the loud minority (from what I've seen at least). I've had my PS5 for a few weeks now and had not one issue. I've played through loads of ps4 games in glorious 60fps and overall just been having a blast. Controller is incredible and probably the best part. Only downside is the small amount of storage (after system 675GB).

Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2020
Review Content: It came next day. Nicely packaged and amazing console. So happy to have got the stock on release date. 4K resolution looks amazing and is definitely worth upgrading from last gen. The console isn’t as big was what I seen on YouTube but is a lot bigger than the PS4 Pro. Unable to put it standing on the bottom shelf so ideally you may want to measure your tv stand to see if it will fit and whether you will need a new one or not.

Name: Amazon Customer
Review Title: No reason at all for the hype
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 February 2021
Review Content: I have no idea why people are so hyped to buy this console. There are literally no games that don’t run on the ps4 that you need to buy the ps5 for. To top it off the console isn’t all that of an upgrade I mean it loads faster and that’s about it. If I could go back in time I wouldn’t have bothered buying it, no need to right now. Stay on the PS4 till 2022 if you have one, no rush.

Name: Richard sutherland
Review Title: Great console if it worked properly
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 February 2021
Review Content: It would have been 5 stars if only it had worked for more than 24 hours. Got it out, set it up. Downloaded the ps4 games I wanted on there ready for play the next day. Immense smooth graphics was really looking forward to playing it, then after 20 mins of play a game crashed I was playing and then the ps5 went off and would not power up again, tried everything system reboots, resets, everything and nothing worked. Contacted Sony which took me over an hour to get an answer and they are arranging a replacement but it will take 7 to 14 days from when they receive the broken one back from me, they sent me a freepost label to send but still had to buy some bubble wrap and a box to send it in. I was not allowed to use the ps5 box, apparently even returns are going missing in the post

Name: C Brittain
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 February 2021
Review Content: One of the lucky few who managed to get hold of one of these game consoles before Christmas. Promptly despatched, packaged well and eagerly received. Great Stuff! Games console- no idea on a review for this but it works as it should and  my son loves it! ( I like the sleeker design but  surprised how big it was)

Name: Furious Monkey
Review Title: Much better than the Series X, performs better too
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2020
Review Content: Chose this over the SX, absolutely brilliant console. Watch dogs looks amazing in 4k ray tracing. Tried astro bot and the dual sense is also a brilliant bit of kit, won't be long before MS come out with one

Name: Pirat
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2020
Review Content: I was waiting for this console ages and I was lucky to receive on day one. Absolutely amazing, its significantly faster then PS4, all games loads really really fast. The biggest surprise its how this console is quite, absolutely no sound, from time to time you can only hear CD spines for few seconds. For me only 1 disadvantage, size of HDD, however it will be able to upgrade in the future.

Name: Dreamz
Review Title: It's a PS5 - what else is there to say? :-)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 December 2020
Review Content: Was my sons 18th birthday recently, couldn't find one anywhere, daily I was refreshing Amazon and suddenly the buy it now option appeared... not believing my eyes, I left the page and went back in - out of stock again... a glitch I thought... so kept refreshing and it appeared again!Needless to say, my son was very surprised on his 18th (especially as we led him to believe we'd bought him a PS4 pro to replace his aging PS4! haha)

Name: Mr. Leigh C. Butler
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Received mine yesterday and all I can say is I'm loving it so far.Played God of War & Bloodborne and the performance increase is incredible. The dual sense controller is also fantastic.Really looking forward to the next generation of gaming as more games come out in the next few years.Must say I would have given this console 5 stars but the disk storage I can see being a little problematic for me.During the PS5 setup you can transfer your existing games over from your ps4 pro for which has 1TB of storage. If I had transferred everything as is then I would have been left with 100GB of free disk space on the PS5. For a brand new console this is slightly frustrating. But still a great console nonetheless.

Name: Andy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 March 2021
Review Content: Love it. Took a while to get hold of one but now I’ve got one it’s amazing. Loading times of PS5 games is immense, graphics not exactly a giant leap but having 60fps is cool. Not got any 120fps games yet. Best thing is the controller... wow! Words cannot describe how amazing it is fully demonstrated with Astro’s playroom. Can’t wait for more games to utilise the haptics/adaptive triggers.

Name: Jonathan Ward
Review Title: Amazing, truly next gen, not stolen
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 December 2020
Review Content: The PS5 is amazing, the controller is truly next gen with the adaptive triggers and haptic feedback. I was literally blown away with how next gen it makes the whole experience feel. Ray tracing looks stunning on a 4k TV.Also my playstation wasn't stolen by the delivery driver so thats a bonus!

Name: Sahar Mahmood
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 March 2021
Review Content: The best PlayStation console ever. The load times. performance beast. Beautiful graphics, stunning games, fast ui, it’s very quiet, incredible controller. This is an amazing console and definitely worth it. I have got every single PlayStation console PS1 PS2 PS3 PSP PS4 & PS5. PlayStation has given me decades of unforgettable gaming moments. And this is just the start of the PS5 journey, it still has many years to go and many great games to come out and play. I also cannot wait for Sony to enable internal ssd to allow larger storage for games. And also the amazing upcoming games. This is PlayStation and play has no limits.

Name: R. GROAT
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 24 November 2020
Review Content: Fantastic console feels amazing premium product in build. Amazing controller you feel everything......wow.Great to get a week later than rest of world, so everything patched giving me no problems. Can't wait for all the proper built from the ground up PS5 games to come out. No rush as loving Assassin's Creed Valhalla and it's a big title.

Name: Anna
Review Title: Andy best deliveey driver in the World.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 March 2021
Review Content: Perfect product but better was driver called Andy as he gone Above and Beyond to get this parcel delivered for me. My one time passcode does not work properly, customer services would not help a lot but he managed after time spend with me to reset his device and code was accepted! Thank you very much Andy, you made one kid very happy tonight! Pay rise for Andy would be great Amazon, drivers like that must be praised by you. Very happy customer :)

Name: Mr. J. J. Proctor
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: This has to be the best console out there, so quiet, and blisteringly quick!!! Game Load's are seconds, Demons Souls is unbelievably smooth and the graphics are outstanding, the haptic feedback is such a good addition, when the triggers are normal, then the become like a trigger with real pressure, get one when you can !!!!

Name: Luke douglas
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2021
Review Content: Controllers already playing up dont purchase

Name: voice of reason
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 December 2020
Review Content: I was so pleased to be offered the early release of the ps5 and I haven’t been disappointed. No crashes or issues so far🤞🏻 It’s a vast improvement on the PS4 with very noticeable speed and graphics improvements. The dual sense is a joy to behold 😉 I’m looking forward to many an hour with my new bestie 😜

Name: Martin Greig
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 November 2020
Review Content: What can I say? The console is a monster.  The controller is an amazing feature in itself.  The size of the machine took me by surprise despite all of the previous videos and information released.  Knocked one star off due to the memory. 865gb, which only 625 can be used..  looks like I’ll be investing in an external HDD as well

Name: Steven P.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 December 2020
Review Content: Easy to set up from the PS 4. The colour and detail in the games - even the PS4 ones Is soooo much better. I’ve not used anywhere near its capacity and apart from it being enormous - so much bigger than anything else released by PlayStation, I can’t fault it at the mo. The controller is a nice weight and appears to be really sturdy.

Name: MO Young
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 March 2021
Review Content: Somehow managed to order one and it arrived within a few days. I had my PS4 from the release date and the difference is noticeable. Absolutely silent when you turn it on unlike the jet engine PS4.Cant wait for games to come out that make use of the extra capabilities!! The controller is next level too and really adds to the gaming experience!I would 100% recommend this if you can manage to get hold of one!!

Name: Brady79
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 February 2021
Review Content: An absolute anti climax!! No actual Ps5 games to play or that have been released yet. No VR menu to separate the games.  Graphics are good but not that much difference to ps4 pro. Haptic controls are nice but will any games actually use this? Probably not!! Sony should be hanging their heads in shame!!

Name: Amarjit Uppal
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 November 2020
Review Content: Great console, truly shambolic how it was released and that scalpers have gotten away with taking so many consoles.

Name: matthew cirino
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 November 2020
Review Content: Impeccable piece of electronic apparatus. Colour is a bit odd considering most devices are black, but it’s a well made unit. Controller is great, love the adaptive triggers. I’ve been lucky enough to secure several of these and sold each one for a tidy profit, which means my console is more than paid for (thanks Amazon!)

Name: Tim Grime
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 February 2021
Review Content: Was delivered on release date. Previously I was using the original PS4 and this is big step up graphics wise especially on a 4k TV. You might want to also budget for an external hard drive if you want to play your old PS4 games as the PS5 storage size isn't great and soon fills up once you have a few games installed. The PS4 games also look great and a lot smoother frame rates.Dual sense controller is brilliant and battery life is OK.Did have issues with some games crashing quite frequently at first like Black Ops but this seems to have been rectified now.

Name: MathersMahmood
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 November 2020
Review Content: Excellent console for next gen gaming. Sometimes it can be a little loud when loading a disk but other than that it’s great.The main thing you will notice is how fast the thing is! The loading times are super quick and it’s sleek.The console is massive though. So bare that in mind.

Name: Sam
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Absolutely love the new PS5 console. I am glad I went with this over the Series X. It's extremely fast and powerful, the new DualSense controller is also very impressive with the haptics and adaptive triggers. Game downloads are quicker too and the 4K/120fps works very well with the supplied HDMI 2.1 cable.

Name: Biggerontheinside
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 February 2021
Review Content: It's a PS5 and its exactly what you would expect from SONY.  Top quality product, but it is also one helluva big machine! Make sure you have the space.

Name: KEVIN
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 February 2021
Review Content: Not used myself as was for the lad. The console is great...so much better then the older models as you would expect. Not had any issues and he hasn't complained about it so must be all good. The downside is the controllers seem to be having issues....just google and you will see problems.....had to get a replacement controller.

Name: Kelvin
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 March 2021
Review Content: +: fast delivery, great finish and features, no loading times, instantly unlocks the potential of your 4k HDR TV.-: I don't like that I have to choose between 30fps and best graphics + ray tracing or 60fps and standard graphics. I hope software can change this in time.

Name: fmant
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 November 2020
Review Content: Great console, fast loading, amazing specs and good game launch line-up (Demon's Souls is a must). Controller and 3D audio make some games really feel next-gen. Sony has said that VRR will be added in the future and the storage does not bother me personally as it does allow you to download and switch between quite a few games really, it's only people who want to have the majority of their games downloaded and ready to play instantly that may have a problem....you can always re-download them!

Name: Will
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 December 2020
Review Content: Absolutely fantastic - continues to go above and beyond expectations. Incredibly quick, brilliant controller and very quiet even when playing graphically demanding games. I can’t wait to see what the future of console gaming will look like and for this console to show what it’s really capable of in years to come!

Name: ETHFLEX
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 April 2021
Review Content: What do I need to say? It’s a ps5. Definitely worth the money especially that u can play all your PS4 titles as well as the enhanced for ps5 ones. Graphics, frame rate, controller are great. The haptic feedback and adaptive triggers really immerse you, especially in a game like COD where u get great trigger feedback. Overall, paired with the right tv, this console is the perfect upgrade and looks amazing. Definitely recommend an OLED if your interested in getting the most out of your PS5

Name: Anthony C.
Review Title: Worth the hype and the wait!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 November 2020
Review Content: Well, it’s huge, but it’s brilliant! Lightening quick load times and a great interface. I love the new controller with its haptic feedback and so far, everything has worked seamlessly. Considering the tech inside, I’d say it was exceptional value for money.If you have a PS Plus subscription, you get a library of some of the best games of the past few years too, including Fallout 4 and Monster Hunter.Thank you Sony!

Name: Carl H.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: An amazing console truly next gen. At a fantastic price as well can't believe they're selling it at a loss to start with. The way the market is going to crash and the demand logistics of making these consoles will mean they are hard to get. PlayStation breaking all records in sales. Only about 1% of people who want one will get one before Christmas. 3% by March and maybe eight to 10% by the end of the year. It won't go down in price maybe up. People's inempt understanding of the situation has made them frustrated and of course in a blame society it's everyone else's fault but there's for not reading the situation .10 out of 10 for PlayStation

Name: Timo Werner
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 February 2021
Review Content: Everything you expect from a next gen console. Simply amazing graphics and load times. Slightly larger and awkward but the performance really makes up for this. Do not buy from ebay at inflated prices whatever you do.

Name: jack dye
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 April 2021
Review Content: Library is a bit thin right now (early April 2021) but everything I’ve played on it has played great. Can’t wait for the big titles to come out later in the year. Got both a PS5 and an XBOX series X in their launch week - the XBOX has maybe been turned on 3 times since the first week I got it. I think that tells you all you need to know.

Name: Rameez
Review Title: Brilliant - and this is just the start
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Brilliant console and I have only had it for a few hours. Sony have really delivered with this one. The immersive experience is now on another whole different level rather than just your controller shaking (PS4 controller). You can now feel everything that happens in the game in the palm of your hands with the new PS5 controller and as more games will come out and utilize the haptic feedback it will only get better. If you can get one, it is highly recommended.

Name: Mr Jones
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 November 2020
Review Content: After the jet engine like sounds of the Ps4, this is a a joy to have in the living room.I love the new controllers too, very ergonomic. They also charge via a USB C connection which always feels more robust.Very pleased with functionality so far, but still building up familiarity with it.

Name: chris styles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 8 January 2021
Review Content: Can't say enough how great the ps5 is had it since launch in the UK its an amazing console definitely would recommend playstation fans getting one

Name: mart
Review Title: PS5 console one of the lucky ones
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: I was one of the few people who managed to order the PS5 Thursday afternoon and it was delivered the day after, what more can you ask for. The console is considerable larger than the PS4 but it looks super slick. The graphics are amazing and the added bulk to the controller is completely understandable when you realise what is included in it, hearing players voices through the controller is brilliant and the sound is so clear. I would definitely recommend the upgrade

Name: Matthew Smithers
Review Title: Finally Got one after waiting months and try and fail on restocks
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 10 March 2021
Review Content: Arrived safely,Due to the size of the console I was worried it wouldn't fit where i wanted it but it was fineNow I wait for more games Exclusive to PS5 or games with upgrades etcGonna take some time getting used to the new Dashboard but looking forward see if the games that made my PS4 sound like a Jet Engine do any better on the PS5

Name: Daniel W.
Review Title: Ps5 a must buy for any one
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 23 November 2020
Review Content: Bit of a beast of a item, but that doesn’t matter because it is one amazing bit of hardware! No waiting around ages for a game or even console to load. Games are played and visually at the best quality you could ask for on a console.One downfall, hard drive needs to be bigger.But 100% recommend.

Name: Josh Ireland
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020

Name: Loredana

Name: Haasher Monib

Name: Mergen Boldbayar

Name: Pete newman
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 February 2021
Review Content: Firstly, big shout to Amazon, I thought I’d missed out on last week’s drop only to get an email Saturday saying fulfilled and arriving the Sunday... My advice get yourself a pulse headset too cracking piece of kit and lastly the controller is truly awesome too. Enjoy peeps.

Name: Dave
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 March 2021

Name: Manas Bajaj
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: Just got mine delivered within 24h of buying on launch day! Have been loving it so far, the truly 'next gen' aspect for me is the 60+ fps gameplay even on 4k resolution!

Name: Jonathan Craigmile
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 November 2020
Review Content: This is a huge step up over my PS4 pro. Not just the graphics and frame rates but also the load times. Lots of people have been talking about the size (and it is huge) but it fits nicely in my TV stand (picture included)I was lucky enough to get it from Amazon at RRP on the 19th and I wouldn't pay a scalper but at £450 I would recommend it as it is cheaper and more available than the new RTX 3000 series and the Radeon 6800 series.

Name: Aiden Hardy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 28 January 2021
Review Content: Truly amazing. You can really tell how fast this is switching from game to game. It’s instant. No delay or lag. Couldn’t ask for a better system. Using the headset on PS4 doesn’t have the same effect. Get this console!

Name: Osman Shabir

Name: Stephen Thom

Name: Natasha
